meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Steve Atkinson Jon Nuckles Shelley Forbess Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #4126.

div.div: (Kermit the Frog: Hi-ho, Kermit the Frog here. Hey, I got a Jeopardy! clue. This game show features Miss Piggy. Give up? What is The Weakest Pork Link? [...She's not here, is she?])

td.p: Steve Atkinson, a history teacher originally from Glasgow, Scotland
Jon Nuckles, an aspiring writer from Evanston, Illinois
Shelley Forbess, a 7th-grade science teacher from El Dorado, Arkansas (whose 1-day cash winnings total $20,000)

tr.td: SHOWTIME AT THE APOLLO PROGRAM
CHEESY COUNTRIES
(Alex: You give us the country; we'll give you the cheese.)
JOCK-ULARITY
CAR TROUBLE
ALONG I-80
"OO", SORRY!

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'Orbiting the moon on Christmas Eve 1968, Apollo 8\'s crew read aloud from this book of the Old Testament')

tr.td: Orbiting the moon on Christmas Eve 1968, Apollo 8's crew read aloud from this book of the Old Testament

Jon

ANCIENT TIMES

WHAT A CARD!
(Alex: Each response will be a playing card.)
COLLEGES & UNIVERSITIES
THE HOMOPHONICS GAME

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
